overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students write equations in standard form, interpret the terms in context, and graph their lines using the <math><mi>x</mi></math>- and <math><mi>y</mi></math>-intercepts. They also express the slope and intercepts from <math><mi>A</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi></math> in general form. They compare point-slope, slope-intercept, and standard forms and identify the slope and intercept from their equations.

overview_item_data_items: I can create an equation to model a linear relationship between two quantities.
I can rewrite equations from point-slope or standard form to slope-intercept form.
I can graph lines using the standard form of a linear equation.

The standard form of a linear equation is <math><mi>A</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi></math>, where <math><mi>A</mi></math>, <math><mi>B</mi></math>, and <math><mi>C</mi></math> are constants, and <math><mi>A</mi></math> and <math><mi>B</mi></math> are not both 0.
An efficient method to graph a line in standard form is to use the <math><mi>x</mi></math>-intercept and <math><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept.

You can express lines in slope-intercept, point slope, and standard form. You can also use the equations <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></math> and <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi></math>, where <math><mi>c</mi></math> and <math><mi>b</mi></math> are constants, to represent lines.
You can determine the slope and <math><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept from any form of an equation of a line.
A situation, equation, table, or graph with a constant rate (or an undefined slope or slope of 0) models a linear relationship.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students identify the characteristics of a line from its equation.
Students match six linear equations to a table, a graph, or a context.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Standard Form of a Linear Equation
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students write equations and interpret the standard form of a linear equation.
Students identify the slope and the <math><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept of linear equations in various forms.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: All the Way Down the Line
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students describe how to determine whether a relationship is linear.

overview_item_data_items: To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
